question: Which of the following kings conquered Delhi from the Tomara chief?
explanation: Vigraharja IV also known as Visaladeva, who ruled from 1150 C.E. to 1164 C.E.Â  was a Chahamana king of north-western India. He turned the Chahamana kingdom into an empire by subduing nearly all the neighboring kings. He conquered Delhi from the Tomara chief.
